meanings.definition: intruded or interfered in a situation where one is not welcome or invited
meanings.sent1: The nosy neighbor interloped into our private conversation.
meanings.sent2: She interloped into the meeting, disrupting the flow of discussion.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel interloped into the bird feeder, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: His loud laughter interloped into the solemn atmosphere of the funeral.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected guest interloped into the carefully planned party, surprising everyone.
